summary: Crater Lake is a stunning volcanic lake in Oregon, USA. It formed around 7,700 years ago when a volcano named Mount Mazama collapsed. The lake is incredibly deep, reaching 1,949 feet, making it the deepest in the United States. Its unique blue color and clear water attract many visitors. There are two small islands in the lake: Wizard Island and Phantom Ship. The lake is protected as part of Crater Lake National Park, where people can enjoy activities like hiking, camping, and skiing. The lake's image is even featured on Oregon's license plates and coins.
title: Crater Lake
